Fix #7902

data.title: ItemList.set_icon_scale() is making all icons the same size, prior to scaling them
data.body:
Consider that you have created item list with items with different size icons. You want to resize them all - relative to their original size.

Expected behavior- They get scaled relative to their actual size when item was added - their original size

Current behavior:
**ItemList.set_icon_scale()** is making all icons the same size, but it should be making each relative to it's original size when item was added? It should NOT be fixing their size to the same value prior to scaling them.

data.title: ItemList - ability to set size on a specific icon in the item list - without affecting the size of the other icons
data.body:
Ability to set individual size on item list icons. Right now when I import images with different sizes, itemlist creates a preview thumbnail for each that has a different size.

However after I implemented a zoom slider, I quickly realized that godot doesnt seem to have an ability to set a new size to each thumbnail in the itemlist that is relative to its old/original size when created.

The function ItemList.set_**fixed**_icon_size(icon_size) sets all thumbnails in the list to be the same size - as a result blurring horribly the more low res ones!

Using ItemList.set_icon_scale() has the same effect unfortunately - making all icons the same size.

Can we please get something like
**itemList.set_icon_size(item_index,icon_size)**
in godot?

Btw I am storing their original size in the metadata, so there is no need for get_icon_size.
Having this feature will also allow me to implement a function that resets the zoom size to the original size

data.title: Added a SceneTree.is_network_peer_present, closes #7922
data.body:
A PR that fixes #7922
Adding a simple function `SceneTree.is_network_peer_present` that checks if a valid peer has been set. Especially useful when making a mixed singleplayer/multiplayer game, where a check should be made before rpc-ing.

data.title: SceneTree lacking an is_network_peer_present() method
data.body:
Godot _current master branch_

Calling rpc() functions without prior setting a networking peer ends up with an error. So I thought, why not secure those calls with a simple check if there is a peer. But appearantly there is no way of telling wether there was a peer set. `is_networking_server()` also errors out if used without a peer.

So, my suggestion: a simple `is_network_peer_present()` function, which would simply return the status of `(SceneTree->)network_peer.is_valid()`. Might come in handy in some situations, where difference between singleplayer and multiplayer should be handled.

data.title: Make editor dialogs resizable and store their bounds
data.body:
Since `WindowDialog`s can be resized now, the Editor dialogs should be made resizable and their location and size stored upon closing them, restoring it upon opening again (of course inside valid bounds).

Helps a bit against https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6437
Obsoletes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7543

data.title: Bad collision against StaticBody2D with LineShape2D
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot 2.1.2 stable**


**Issue description:**
A StaticBody2D with a LineShape2D get incorrect collision against other bodies (or bodies against the static line).

It was expected to get collisions checked against full shapes, not just the "lower" part.

**Steps to reproduce:**

 - Create a StaticBody2D with a horizontal LineShape2D, like a floor.
 - Create a RigidBody2D with a CircleShape2D over the line, rotate it a bit. 
 - Look how the RigidBody2D hangs below the line.

Happens with other shapes against a line.

![lineshapebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/23488124/6905559a-fec9-11e6-8b70-f15a513609a5.gif)


**Link to minimal example project:**
[StaticLineBug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/812469/StaticLineBug.zip)

data.title: Area2D panics when added to scene tree in colliding position
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot v2.1.2 Stable.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
TL;DR version: Basically the following is spamming the debugger output. Although collisions are working fine.

File: area_2d.cpp , line: 165
```
ERR_FAIL_COND(!body_in && !E);
```

Detailed verison: my issue is that I am trying to implement a node that changes its children after a set of time (like toggle between two states every 5 seconds). When I do `add_child` to the node that contains Area2D, and at the same time, let's say the player was in the location where the object is about to toggle its state by adding child node, the error happens (using `add_child`). The Area2D has `body_enter` signal.

Have a look [here in the forum's post](https://godotengine.org/qa/4846/remove_node-gives-strange-error-on-specific-node-structure) about this issue. I was kind of happy when I thought the issue is fixed, when I changed the overlapping collision shapes of the node containing Area2D (the parent node has a KinematicBody2D too). But soon I realized the issue appears again when dealing with other nodes (like the one toggles its state) at the same location.
 
Things I tried, 
- `call_deferred` for adding or removing the node that contains the Area2D didn't work.
- disconnect before removing Area2D's parent (using `remove_child`) and `connect` again before `add_child`

My only option which I don't like to go there, is to make Area2D permanent and never removed or added (by putting it in a different parent), and switch or toggle states using code. That would be ugly.

Like I said, collisions are working fine, even when `add_child` for the Area2D (maybe the collisions are reported in the next frame, which I don't care as long as they are reported). Only the debugger output spamming. I wish to know if there is a cleaner approach.

Any suggestions!

Issues similar to this:
Issue #3589 (closed)
**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:

data.title: Passing function as arguments?
Fix RANDOM_MAX, which is 2^32-1 with PCG32.
data.body: It seems that Math::RANDOM_MAX wasn't updated when the RNG implementation changed. Currently, randf() generates numbers out of the 0..1 range. This change fixes this issue.

data.title: TabContainer's signal changes (v3)
data.body:
- `tab_changed` signal emits only by selecting a different tab.
- Added `tab_selected` signal. Which emits a signal by selecting any tab, even if current tab is being selected again.
- Added `get_previous_tab()`. Which returns the previous shown tab index. **Note:** only `tab_changed` can modify previous tab index.
- Add documentation for the added function and signals. Fix a typo too.
- Fix #7752

data.title: Buttons stops to process signal
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux XUbuntu 16.04.1, Godot 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
My code is with weird behavior. I try to prealloc the scene in the main scene as children, for example: the Game scene creates two instances from another two scenes and the game scene add the two as children. So, with this I tried avoid reloading the sub scenes.
Then, when I try active one scene, I use:```

	# name is the name of new scene
	if (name == "mainmenu"):
		mainmenu.set_as_toplevel(true)
		mainmenu.show()
		mainmenu.set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS)
		
		if (level == null):
			level = Level.instance()
			add_child(level)
		level.hide()
		level.set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_STOP)
		get_tree().set_pause(true)
		set_pause_mode(PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS)
``` ```

Whats happens is the scene freeze when add another child the buttons of the scene stops to receive input, but the scene node with the buttons still running, because it was setted with PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS and the other child was setted with PAUSE_MODE_STOP, but the buttons from the first scene not works properly, it's like the scene was setted with PAUSE_MODE_STOP too.

So, to activate one scene, I set the hidden to PAUSE_MODE_STOP and the other scene as toplevel and set the pause mode to PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS, I think that this mode the buttons should works fine, but not, the buttons are freeze!

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/811229/Test.zip)

Press space to show messages, you will see that when freeze the scene not stop, but the buttons not process signals

#

data.title: Implement time scaling for the rasterizer

~~Disabled by default.~~

Useful for instance if your game features some effects dependant on time and you want them to freeze during pause.

_Disclaimer: I've done my best to adapt this to the 3.0 style. I implemented this initially for 2.1 so I'm not sure if this is the right way. Someone should have a look._

~~Also committed the changes for 2.1 for historic reasons.~~

data.title: error when multiply fixed floating number with int coefficient.
data.body:
Hello,

OS: ArchLinux
Godot version: 2.1.2

When multiply a float value with an int, you get with low values of the coefficient correct results.

And then, everything goes mad: as it's still fixed values for the result, there seems to have overflow somewhere.

**Test code (godot -e test.gd):** 

```
extends MainLoop
func _initialize():
  for i in range(1,10):
    print("for %d * 5.12 : %f" % [i, i*5.12])

```

which gives:

> for 1 * 5.12 : 5.120000
> for 2 * 5.12 : 10.240000
> for 3 * 5.12 : 15.360000
> for 4 * 5.12 : 20.480000
> for 5 * 5.12 : 25.599999
> for 6 * 5.12 : 30.719999
> for 7 * 5.12 : 35.839999
> for 8 * 5.12 : 40.959999
> for 9 * 5.12 : 46.079999

So you see the results are correct until coefficient reaches 5.

data.title: Implement time scaling for the rasterizer (2.1)
data.body: Useful for instance if your game features some effects dependant on time and you want them to freeze during pause.

data.title: Implement single-field property change for multinode edit
data.body:
This allows you to change only one component of any math-typed property during a multi-node edit. The way of telling the editor you want to change only the focused component is to hit __Shift + Enter__. Hitting just __Enter__ will set the whole value, as always.

For instance, you have some sprites at different _x_ coordinates but sharing the same _y_. Now you'll be able to change only the _y_ value by selecting them all, editing the position property, focusing the _y_ field and entering a new value.

This works for vectors, rects, bounding-boxes, transforms, etc.

Closes #7538.

EDIT: This may need testing so now _master_ is unstable we have a great chance.

data.title: Implement single-field property change for multinode edit (2.1)
data.body:
This allows you to change only one component of any math-typed property during a multi-node edit. The way of telling the editor you want to change only the focused component is to hit __Shift + Enter__. Hitting just __Enter__ will set the whole value, as always.

For instance, you have some sprites at different _x_ coordinates but sharing the same _y_. Now you'll be able to change only the _y_ value by selecting them all, editing the position property, focusing the _y_ field and entering a new value.

This works for vectors, rects, bounding-boxes, transforms, etc.

Closes #7538.

EDIT: I'd say this needs some testing. I will be testing it myself from now on.

data.title: Cherry-pick modulate (color) for TileSet tiles (2.1)
data.body:
(cherry picked from commit 86789c7071836b802e6edb0538ce6de2b7949c7b)

This was initially implemented for 2.1. Got merged in _master_, but is fine for 2.1 and backwards compatible.

data.title: In-editor navmesh generation.
data.body:
Adds support for building navmeshes from within the editor itself with Recast integration. Currently, this is only possible from within Blender, severely limiting if you want to arrange modular geometry from within the editor.

Right now, this only covers the generation of navmeshes to the simple  internal format, but could be expanded to support further features such as off-mesh-links, tagging areas with different costs, or even having the navmesh tiled to regenerate itself automatically if geometry changes.

This also currently only supports generated navmeshes from MeshInstances, but I will likely add support for doing it from StaticBodies too when I've figured out how to rasterize collision objects into triangles.

Right now though, the functionality matches what is available in Blender at least, so I'd consider it a must-have for anyone doing even the most basic 3D AI systems. It can also be completely disabled from within the build settings.

Addresses #3785

data.title: Buttons don't work on Android game console
data.body:
I would like to test your game for Exeq Ray, but my buttons do not work (sensor broken). Only work ABXY.
I checked on the demo example "Joystick", but there I found work LT/RT (but I have not used)  and A/B/X/Y.
Later, I wrote a small test and found out that Godot does not see these buttons. Verification code:
```
extends Control

func _ready():	set_process_input(true)

func _input(event):
	var var1 = event.type
	var var2 = event.ID
	var var3 = event.device
	get_node("Label").set_text(str(var1)+"\n"+str(var2)+"\n"+str(var3))
```

data.title: Use the common PRNG in 2D particles code.
data.body: Also removed the custom PRNG used by 2D particles code in favor of the PRNG located under core/math.

data.title: Fix failing build when ALSA is absent
data.body:
There was an error about undeclared malloc()+free() when lib64alsa-devel was not installed. If ALSA is installed, then the ALSA headers provide <stdlib.h> so the problem is gone. Here are some relevant IRC logs:

```
<rindolf> Hi all.
<rindolf> Akien: does the build on mgav6 succeed for you without this commit - https://github.com/shlomif/godot/tree/fix-build-compile-error ?
* Giacom has quit (Ping timeout: 268 seconds)
<Akien> rindolf: Let me check, I built yesterday but maybe it was just before I merged that PR.
<Akien> TMM: See https://github.com/shlomif/godot/tree/fix-build-compile-error
<rindolf> Akien: thanks
<Akien> rindolf: It builds fine for me on mga6 x86_64
<Akien> With `scons p=x11 -j3`
<rindolf> Akien: ah
<rindolf> Akien: which branch - mine or master?
<Akien> rindolf: In master
<rindolf> Akien: oh
<Akien> Well upstream/master
<rindolf> Akien: hmmm
<rindolf> Akien: i'm still getting the build failure with scons platform=x11 2>&1 | tee ~/godot.build.txt
<Akien> I'll try a build from scratch
<rindolf> Akien: it seems to be fine here after I install the --buildrequires of godot
<Akien> Ah?
<rindolf> Akien: maybe there was a missing dep,
<Akien> What was the missing dep?
<rindolf> Akien: let me bisect
<rindolf> Akien: it happens with lib64alsa2-devel lib64theora-devel missing
<Akien> rindolf: It's peculiar that it would then be fixed by including stdlib.h
<Akien> Unless alsa includes it in its headers and so it happens to be there when needed by Godot
<rindolf> Akien: well, stdlib.h contains malloc() and free()
<Akien> And yeah, <alsa/asoundlib.h> includes <stdlib.h>
<Akien> So your patch seems necessary indeed
<rindolf> Akien: ah, shall I submit a pull-req?
<Akien> rindolf: sure.
<rindolf> Akien: ok
```

data.title: Darken the editor window if a pop-up window is open
data.body:
To make the editor more polished, it would be a good idea to darken the editor window if a pop-up window is open, such as a file selection dialog or a progress action, especially since you can't interact with the background in this case (if you do, you usually close the pop-up window if it's closeable). Of course, it shouldn't be too dark to keep the background readable, a 50% darkening sounds good.

Similar behavior can be observed in eg. KDE.

data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!

I'm using Godot Engine 2.1

data.title: Indentation handled by number of characters, not indentation width
data.body:
The following GDScript code is valid and accepted by the parser (emphasis is on the indentation):
```
										extends Tabs

func _ready():
	var x = 0
	if 1 == 1:
	 x = 10
		x = 20
  x = 30
 x = 40
	x = 50
```

This is impossible to understand without revealing the whitespace characters used:
```
[-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-][-TAB-]extends Tabs

func _ready():
[-TAB-]var x = 0
[-TAB-]if 1 == 1:
[-TAB-][SPACE]x = 10
[-TAB-][-TAB-]x = 20
[SPACE][SPACE]x = 30
[SPACE]x = 40
[-TAB-]x = 50
```

Obviously, the GDScript parser only handles indentation by counting the characters used to indent, not the visual width of them like Python does.
Then again it seems to ignore whitespace at the start of a file.

I think it would be better to handle it like Python, defaulting tabs to a specific number of equivalent spaces, and then using the resulting indentation width rather than character count. S. http://www.secnetix.de/olli/Python/block_indentation.hawk section "How does the compiler parse the indentation?" about the Python indentation implementation which I would recommend for GDScript aswell.

On a side note, multiple instances of this parser error popped up when opening such an indented file (though this was in a 2.2 build):
```
ERROR: GDParser::_reduce_expression: Method/Function Failed, returning: op
   At: modules\gdscript\gd_parser.cpp:1540
```

data.title: Add process mode option to Particles2D
data.body: Regarding 3D particles, the code for processing them is tightly coupled with the rasterizer's so a counterpartish change is not possible.
